description: The `synthetic.social_metrics` table is designed to track various metrics related to social interactions, with `metric_id` serving as the unique identifier for each metric in the dataset. Although no specific column names or sample data are available, the table is part of a larger schema in the `synthetic_250_postgres` database and does not currently have any rows or defined relationships to other tables. It appears to play a role in capturing and organizing unspecified social metric data within this synthetic dataset, but without additional context or data, its precise function remains unspecified.

columns.name: metric_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies individual social metrics records within the table. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: post_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each post within the social metrics dataset. It is a mandatory field likely used to associate specific metrics with individual posts.

columns.name: recorded_at
columns.description: The purpose of this column is unclear from available data due to the absence of sample values.

columns.name: impressions
columns.description: This column likely represents the number of times a social media post or advertisement has been displayed to users. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: reach
columns.description: This column likely measures the potential audience size exposed to social media content or campaigns, representing the number of unique individuals reached. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: likes
columns.description: Represents the number of positive acknowledgments or approvals received on a social media post. The total count may be absent if it wasn't recorded.

columns.name: comments
columns.description: This column indicates the number of user comments related to a particular social media post or entity. The value can be missing, and it defaults to zero when unspecified.

columns.name: shares
columns.description: The column represents the number of times a piece of content has been shared across social platforms. If no data is available, it defaults to indicating no shares.

columns.name: clicks
columns.description: The column likely quantifies user engagements or interactions on social media content within the dataset. Purpose unclear from available data, as sample values were not provided.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column captures the date and time when a record was created within the social metrics table. The specific business context or significance of this timestamp is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a record in the social metrics table was last modified. It is updated automatically to the current timestamp each time a modification occurs, ensuring changes are tracked chronologically.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX social_metrics_pkey ON synthetic.social_metrics USING btree (metric_id)
